repnme.cdata!: El Salvador - Social Sector Rehabilitation Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Social Sector
            Rehabilitation Project for El Salvador were as follows: Bank
            performance was satisfactory; and Borrower performance was
            satisfactory. Some lessons learned included: to prevent
            initial project delays and to reach realistic estimates of
            project costs and disbursements, the implementing
            agencies' commitment and institutional capacity have to
            be carefully ascertained and taken into account in project
            design. It is important to design, from project onset, an
            accounting system compatible with the requirements of the
            government and the Bank to administer project expenditures;
            the project coordinating unit should issue monthly reports
            by item of expenditure, on expenditures and reimbursement
            requests, and on available balances in each category; those
            reports should be made available, also on a monthly basis,
            to the executing agencies or units and to the procurement
            agent. Joint Government and Bank annual reviews of project
            progress enabled them to maintain flexibility in
            implementation, while keeping in mind original project
            objectives. The limiting of access to expert advice for
            defining expected products and for preparing terms of
            reference and specifications for complex studies and
            equipment caused delays, worked against the optimal quality
            of studies or equipment selected, and ultimately increased
            costs. Improvement or development of management information
            system (MIS) in all sectors is a delicate task whose success
            does not only depend on availability of electronic
            equipment, but on highly skilled technical expertise.
            Although the inclusion of studies and research is important
            in projects intended to implement changes in service
            delivery to reach underserved groups, there needs to be a
            clear plan defining the topics, the administration of the
            studies and provisions for their use and dissemination.

731856.majtheme: Human development,Social protection and risk management

repnme.cdata!: El Salvador - Social Sector Rehabilitation Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The objectives of the Social Sector
            Rehabilitation Project are to: (a) improve the delivery of
            basic social services targeted to some 80 of the most
            disadvantaged municipalities. The project will finance two
            main components. The first component, basic services
            development, will improve the delivery of basic social
            services to the project area through: (a) a primary health
            care program consisting of family planning, maternal and
            child health care, and health and nutrition education, and
            safe motherhood referral program; and (b) pre-primary and
            primary school program including implementation of community
            operated schools, provision of teaching materials and
            textbooks, nutrition assistance and staff training. The
            second component, institutional development, aims to: (a)
            strengthen the Ministry of Health management and technical
            capacity to plan and deliver health services efficiently and
            improve cost-recovery systems; (b) increase the Ministry of
            Education's capacity in planning and management of
            services delivery; and (c) strengthen the Ministry of
            Planning's capacity to develop a social sectors
            information system, analyze social investment programs, and
            evaluate their impact.
